p: Next Generation Sequencing (NGS) allows for an in-depth characterization of the genetic diversity among rapidly mutating virus populations by directly sequencing viral strains at the interspecific as well as the intraspecific level [ 17, 18]. The technology has been successfully applied to identify the diversity in the viral genome of pigs’ faeces [ 15, 19– 21]. The aim of the present study is to explore the diversity of RNA viruses present in faeces of neonatal piglets suffering from diarrhoea in Spain, applying a tailor-made NGS protocol using the total RNA extracted, without any amplification step, where the results obtained represent not only the RNA viruses present in a sample, but also their relative abundances.
